results.title: Challenge of the north
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, Beaconsfield Films and Pilot Films
results.brief_description: A record of the exploits and accomplishments of the British North Greenland Expedition of 1952-54, led by Commander C.T.W. Simpson. The general purpose of this venture was to find the answers to problems of climate, weather and ice, and also to discover how best to live and work in Arctic conditions. Narrated by James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Challenge of the future. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of Energy. Research and Development Branch for Solar Heating and Cooling
results.brief_description: Reviews the problems and options which face the United States in meeting the growing energy crises. Visits a number of laboratories and pilot plants in energy research and development, and shows solar, geothermal, and advanced energy systems as alternatives to petroleum energy sources. Revised version of the motion picture issued in 1975 under the same title.

results.title: The Challenge of leadership
results.brief_description: Illustrates how leadership arises naturally in a critical situation. Helps supervisor identify and discuss the qualities that make a leader and the skills used in applying leadership by voluntary consent of the group.

results.title: Challenge in the air
results.creator_credit: British Movietone News and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: The Society of British Aircraft Constructor’s 17th Flying Display and Exhibition at Farnborough in 1956, which featured some of the latest developments in British aircraft and aero-engines. Among aircraft on view was the Fairey “Delta 2”, in which Peter Twiss had set up the world air speed record for Britain. Engines were a special feature of the show and demonstrations of the de Havilland “Super Sprite” and Napier “Scorpion” liquid propellent rocket motors are seen.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Frank Killian and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: This is a tribute to the Australians who sailed Gretel” in the America’s Cup…” Traces the construction of the Australian challenger, “Gretel”, its trials in America, and finally its efforts in the America’s Cup yacht races.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: John Carter, Wayne Le Clos, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film deals with a situation in which one man is promoted over an another who has more experience in the same area. The man overlooked displays his resentment by insisting that nothing has changed and that he will continue to behave as he has always done. The question posed concerns the preservation of old relationships after promotion while making it clear that one is now boss. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Carter, Wayne Le Clos, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: A Chairy tale
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film depicts a young man and a chair (animated by Evelyn Lambart) that declines to be sat upon. The ensuing struggle, sometimes farcical, sometimes thoughtful, is an open-ended commentary on relationships. The technique used is pixilation. The musical accompaniment is by Ravi Shankar and Chatur Lal.

results.title: Chains of circumstance
results.brief_description: Three case histories of poverty show the work of the Freemasons’ Benevolent Institution in New South Wales. The Institution was founded in 1880 as a means of helping the aged, invalid and distressed. From a system of voluntary subscriptions, annuities are granted to those who need help.

results.title: Chain reaction
results.brief_description: A silent film without subtext about one’s bad humour on others. An office manager whose wife spills the tea on his morning paper upsets his wife, their children and his subordinates at work. No other credits available.

results.title: Ceramic glazes
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the mixing of an opaque matt and stone glaze, both showing wide firing latitude and high colour receptivity. Glaze application by several methods is shown. Kiln interiors at intervals during firing show the progressive stages of the glaze.
